intro: Draba aizoides var. brevistyla, commonly known as the short-styled whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils. It has basal leaves that are linear to oblanceolate in shape, and its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. This variety is distinguished by its shorter styles compared to other varieties within the species.
